p: In December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei Province; China reported an outbreak of a highly communicable viral infection. Initially, it was reported to be a form of treatment resistant pneumonia. Subsequently, it was recognized that the etiologic agent was, in fact, a novel Coronavirus. Humans had never before been exposed to this infectious agent, and carried no immunity to prevent its spectrum of clinical manifestations ranging from mild, even asymptomatic courses, to severe, even fatal disease, with a particular targeting of the respiratory tract [ 2]. SARS-CoV-2, the etiological agent of COVID-19, has now infected patients across 210 countries and terratories, and has fomented a catastrophic global crisis, associated with medical, economic, and psychosocial ramifications of immense magnitude.The World Health Organization declared the outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on January 30, 2020 [ [3], [4], [5], [6], [7], [8]].
